title: 115_hr4610
content: The Act is titled the "Receiving Electronic Statements To Improve Retiree Earnings Act" and it involves electronic communication of pension plan information under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. "A document required for a pension plan can be provided electronically if the system ensures effective access for the recipient through direct delivery to an electronic address or posting on a designated website." The document can be provided electronically to participants, beneficiaries, or individuals with proper notice and the option to select specific electronic means for delivery. The document can be provided electronically with the option for individuals to select specific electronic means for delivery and the right to modify their selection at any time. An annual paper notice must be provided to describe the chosen electronic means and the right to make changes. The electronically furnished document must be consistent with style, format, and content requirements, and include a notice explaining its significance when not evident. The term 'document' includes various types of information. A conforming amendment is made to the table of contents in the Act. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow electronic communication of pension plan information to participants, beneficiaries, or other individuals. Documents can be furnished electronically if the system ensures effective access to the information. The amendment allows electronic communication of pension plan information to participants, beneficiaries, or individuals through various electronic means such as posting on a website or other electronic repositories, and other means to ensure actual receipt of the material. The amendment allows electronic communication of pension plan information, giving individuals the option to select specific electronic means for document delivery, protecting personal information, and providing an annual paper notice describing the electronic means chosen. The amendment allows electronic communication of pension plan information, giving individuals the option to select specific electronic means for document delivery, protecting personal information, and providing an annual paper notice describing the electronic means chosen, including the right to modify the selection at any time or elect to receive paper versions of documents at no additional cost. The amendment permits electronic delivery of pension plan information, ensuring compliance with document requirements and protecting existing methods of document transmission. The amendment allows electronic delivery of pension plan information, with the Secretaries having the authority to prescribe additional methods if necessary. Effective date for the amendments is after December 31, 2018.
